description: From the London, England fishmarket Billingsgate: "Billingsgate is the market where the fishwomen assemble to purchase fish; and where, in their dealings and disputes they are somewhat apt to leave decency and good manners a little on the left hand." (Dictionary of the Vulgar Tongue, 1811).

examples: You wouldn't have believed the billingsgate which poured forth from that boy's mouth.

verbs.description: billingsgate (third-person singular simple present billingsgates, present participle billingsgating, simple past and past participle billingsgated)

examples: On the other hand, the Englishman has the satisfaction of Billingsgating to his heart's content the highest officials: they accept objurgation with spaniel fawning.
